<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getMySql.ts#L89">property <b>mysqlUserConfig</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>mysqlUserConfig?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aiven/types/input/#GetMySqlMysqlUserConfig'>inputs.GetMySqlMysqlUserConfig</a>;</code></pre>

defines MySQL specific additional configuration options. The following
configuration options available:

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetMySqlArgs-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getMySql.ts#L100">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetMySqlArgs-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getMySql.ts#L106">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetMySqlArgs-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getMySql.ts#L115">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetMySqlResult-plan">

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current

names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

prevents the service from being deleted. It is recommended to
set this to `true` for all production services to prevent unintentional service
deletion. This does not shield against deleting databases or topics but for services
with backups much of the content can at least be restored from backup in case accidental
deletion is done.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetPgResult-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getPg.ts#L171">property <b>cloudName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cloudName?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

defines PostgreSQL specific additional configuration options. The following
configuration options available:

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetPgResult-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getPg.ts#L206">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetPgResult-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getPg.ts#L207">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetPgResult-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getPg.ts#L216">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRedisArgs-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getRedis.ts#L69">property <b>cloudName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cloudName?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getRedis.ts#L75">property <b>maintenanceWindowDow</b></a>

On monday, tuesday, wednesday, etc.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRedisArgs-maintenanceWindowTime">

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maintenanceWindowTime?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

time of day when maintenance operations should be performed.
UTC time in HH:mm:ss format.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRedisArgs-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getRedis.ts#L91">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRedisArgs-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getRedis.ts#L97">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRedisArgs-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getRedis.ts#L106">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>terminationProtection?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'>false</span> | <span class='kd'>true</span>;</code></pre>

prevents the service from being deleted. It is recommended to
set this to `true` for all production services to prevent unintentional service
deletion. This does not shield against deleting databases or topics but for services
with backups much of the content can at least be restored from backup in case accidental
deletion is done.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRedisResult-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getRedis.ts#L171">property <b>cloudName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cloudName?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

</h4>

UTC time in HH:mm:ss format.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRedisResult-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getRedis.ts#L197">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRedisResult-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getRedis.ts#L198">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRedisResult-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getRedis.ts#L207">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="GetServiceComponentArgs" data-link-title="GetServiceComponentArgs">

        interface <strong>GetServiceComponentArgs</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>GetServiceComponentArgs</span></code></pre>

A collection of arguments for invoking getServiceComponent.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetServiceComponentArgs-component">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getServiceComponent.ts#L65">property <b>component</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>component: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

is a service component name. Component may match the name of the service
(`cassandra`, `elasticsearch`, `grafana`, `influxdb`, `kafka`, `kafkaConnect`, `mysql`,
`pg` and `redis`), in which case the connection info of the service itself is returned.
Some service types support additional service specific components like `kibana` for
Elasticsearch, `kafkaConnect`, `kafkaRest` and `schemaRegistry` for Kafka, and
`pgbouncer` for PostgreSQL. Most service types also support `prometheus`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetServiceComponentArgs-kafkaAuthenticationMethod">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getServiceComponent.ts#L72">property <b>kafkaAuthenticationMethod</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>kafkaAuthenticationMethod?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

is Kafka authentication method. This is a value specific
to the 'kafka' service components. And has the following available options: `certificate`
and `sasl`. If not set by the user only entries with empty `kafkaAuthenticationMethod`
will be selected.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetServiceComponentArgs-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getServiceComponent.ts#L77">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

and `serviceName` - (Required) define the project and service the service component
belongs to.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetServiceComponentArgs-route">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getServiceComponent.ts#L86">property <b>route</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>route?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

is network access route. The route may be one of `dynamic`, `public`, and `private`.
Usually, you'll want to use `dynamic`, which for services that are not in a private network
identifies the regular public DNS name of the service and for services in a private network
the private DNS name. If the service is in a private network but has also public access
enabled the `public` route type can be used to get the public DNS name of the service. The
`private` option should typically not be used.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetServiceComponentArgs-serviceName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getServiceComponent.ts#L87">property <b>serviceName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>serviceName?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetServiceComponentArgs-ssl">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getServiceComponent.ts#L94">property <b>ssl</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>ssl?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'>false</span> | <span class='kd'>true</span>;</code></pre>

whether the endpoint is encrypted or accepts plaintext. By default endpoints are
always encrypted and this property is only included for service components they may
disable encryption. If not set by the user only entries with empty `ssl` or `ssl` set
to true will be selected.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetServiceComponentArgs-usage">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getServiceComponent.ts#L103">property <b>usage</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>usage?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

is DNS usage name, and can be one of `primary`, `replica` or `syncing`. `replica`
is used by services that have separate master and standby roles for which it identifies
the `replica` DNS name. `syncing` is used by limited set of services to expose nodes
before they have finished restoring state but may already be partially available, for
example a PostgreSQL node that is streaming WAL segments from backup or current master
but hasn't yet fully caught up.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetServiceComponentResult-ssl">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getServiceComponent.ts#L133">property <b>ssl</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>ssl?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'>false</span> | <span class='kd'>true</span>;</code></pre>

whether the endpoint is encrypted or accepts plaintext. By default endpoints are
always encrypted and this property is only included for service components they may
disable encryption. If not set by the user only entries with empty `ssl` or `ssl` set
to true will be selected.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetServiceComponentResult-usage">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/getServiceComponent.ts#L142">property <b>usage</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>usage?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

is DNS usage name, and can be one of `primary`, `replica` or `syncing`. `replica`
is used by services that have separate master and standby roles for which it identifies
the `replica` DNS name. `syncing` is used by limited set of services to expose nodes
before they have finished restoring state but may already be partially available, for
example a PostgreSQL node that is streaming WAL segments from backup or current master
but hasn't yet fully caught up.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GrafanaArgs-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/grafana.ts#L365">property <b>cloudName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cloudName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GrafanaArgs-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/grafana.ts#L396">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GrafanaArgs-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/grafana.ts#L411">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GrafanaArgs-terminationProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/grafana.ts#L429">property <b>terminationProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>terminationProtection?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

prevents the service from being deleted. It is recommended to
set this to `true` for all production services to prevent unintentional service
deletion. This does not shield against deleting databases or topics but for services
with backups much of the content can at least be restored from backup in case accidental
deletion is done.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GrafanaState-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/grafana.ts#L253">property <b>cloudName</b></a>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InfluxDbArgs-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/influxDb.ts#L392">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InfluxDbArgs-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/influxDb.ts#L407">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InfluxDbArgs-terminationProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/influxDb.ts#L425">property <b>terminationProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>terminationProtection?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

prevents the service from being deleted. It is recommended to
set this to `true` for all production services to prevent unintentional service
deletion. This does not shield against deleting databases or topics but for services
with backups much of the content can at least be restored from backup in case accidental
deletion is done.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaArgs-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L381">property <b>cloudName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cloudName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L385">property <b>defaultAcl</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>defaultAcl?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaArgs-kafkaUserConfig">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L394">property <b>kafkaUserConfig</b></a>

defines Kafka specific additional configuration options. The following
configuration options available:

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaArgs-maintenanceWindowDow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L399">property <b>maintenanceWindowDow</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maintenanceWindowDow?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

day of week when maintenance operations should be performed.
On monday, tuesday, wednesday, etc.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaArgs-maintenanceWindowTime">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L404">property <b>maintenanceWindowTime</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maintenanceWindowTime?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

time of day when maintenance operations should be performed.
UTC time in HH:mm:ss format.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaArgs-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L415">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaArgs-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L421">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaArgs-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L430">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaArgs-serviceIntegrations">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L434">property <b>serviceIntegrations</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>serviceIntegrations?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aiven/types/input/#KafkaServiceIntegration'>KafkaServiceIntegration</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Service integrations to specify when creating a service. Not applied after initial service creation

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaArgs-serviceName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L440">property <b>serviceName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>serviceName: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

specifies the actual name of the service. The name cannot be changed
later without destroying and re-creating the service so name should be picked based on
intended service usage rather than current attributes.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaArgs-terminationProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L448">property <b>terminationProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>terminationProtection?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

prevents the service from being deleted. It is recommended to
set this to `true` for all production services to prevent unintentional service
deletion. This does not shield against deleting databases or topics but for services
with backups much of the content can at least be restored from backup in case accidental
deletion is done.

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaConnectArgs-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaConnect.ts#L413">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>serviceIntegrations?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aiven/types/input/#KafkaConnectServiceIntegration'>KafkaConnectServiceIntegration</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Service integrations to specify when creating a service. Not applied after initial service creation

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaConnectArgs-serviceName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaConnect.ts#L423">property <b>serviceName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>serviceName: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

specifies the actual name of the service. The name cannot be changed
later without destroying and re-creating the service so name should be picked based on
intended service usage rather than current attributes.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaConnectArgs-terminationProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaConnect.ts#L431">property <b>terminationProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>terminationProtection?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

prevents the service from being deleted. It is recommended to
set this to `true` for all production services to prevent unintentional service
deletion. This does not shield against deleting databases or topics but for services
with backups much of the content can at least be restored from backup in case accidental
deletion is done.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaConnectState-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaConnect.ts#L255">property <b>cloudName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cloudName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaConnectState-kafkaConnectUserConfig">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaConnect.ts#L269">property <b>kafkaConnectUserConfig</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>kafkaConnectUserConfig?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aiven/types/input/#KafkaConnectKafkaConnectUserConfig'>KafkaConnectKafkaConnectUserConfig</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines kafka Connect specific additional configuration options.
The following configuration options available:

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaConnectState-maintenanceWindowDow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaConnect.ts#L274">property <b>maintenanceWindowDow</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maintenanceWindowDow?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

day of week when maintenance operations should be performed.
On monday, tuesday, wednesday, etc.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaConnectState-maintenanceWindowTime">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaConnect.ts#L279">property <b>maintenanceWindowTime</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maintenanceWindowTime?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

time of day when maintenance operations should be performed.
UTC time in HH:mm:ss format.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaConnectState-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaConnect.ts#L290">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaConnectState-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaConnect.ts#L296">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaConnectState-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaConnect.ts#L305">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaMirrorMakerArgs-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaMirrorMaker.ts#L363">property <b>cloudName</b></a>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maintenanceWindowTime?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

UTC time in HH:mm:ss format.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaMirrorMakerArgs-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaMirrorMaker.ts#L393">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaMirrorMakerArgs-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaMirrorMaker.ts#L399">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaMirrorMakerArgs-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaMirrorMaker.ts#L408">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaMirrorMakerState-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaMirrorMaker.ts#L301">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaMirrorMakerState-terminationProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafkaMirrorMaker.ts#L347">property <b>terminationProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>terminationProtection?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

prevents the service from being deleted. It is recommended to
set this to `true` for all production services to prevent unintentional service
deletion. This does not shield against deleting databases or topics but for services
with backups much of the content can at least be restored from backup in case accidental
deletion is done.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaState-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L266">property <b>cloudName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cloudName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaState-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L304">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaState-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L310">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaState-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L319">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KafkaState-terminationProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/kafka.ts#L365">property <b>terminationProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>terminationProtection?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

prevents the service from being deleted. It is recommended to
set this to `true` for all production services to prevent unintentional service
deletion. This does not shield against deleting databases or topics but for services
with backups much of the content can at least be restored from backup in case accidental
deletion is done.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3AggregatorArgs-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3aggregator.ts#L360">property <b>cloudName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cloudName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

The following configuration options available:

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3AggregatorArgs-maintenanceWindowDow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3aggregator.ts#L374">property <b>maintenanceWindowDow</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maintenanceWindowDow?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

day of week when maintenance operations should be performed.
On monday, tuesday, wednesday, etc.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3AggregatorArgs-maintenanceWindowTime">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3aggregator.ts#L379">property <b>maintenanceWindowTime</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maintenanceWindowTime?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

time of day when maintenance operations should be performed.
UTC time in HH:mm:ss format.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3AggregatorArgs-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3aggregator.ts#L390">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3AggregatorArgs-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3aggregator.ts#L396">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3AggregatorArgs-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3aggregator.ts#L405">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3AggregatorArgs-serviceIntegrations">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3aggregator.ts#L409">property <b>serviceIntegrations</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>serviceIntegrations?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aiven/types/input/#M3AggregatorServiceIntegration'>M3AggregatorServiceIntegration</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Service integrations to specify when creating a service. Not applied after initial service creation

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3AggregatorArgs-serviceName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3aggregator.ts#L415">property <b>serviceName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>serviceName: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

specifies the actual name of the service. The name cannot be changed
later without destroying and re-creating the service so name should be picked based on
intended service usage rather than current attributes.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3AggregatorArgs-terminationProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3aggregator.ts#L423">property <b>terminationProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>terminationProtection?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

prevents the service from being deleted. It is recommended to
set this to `true` for all production services to prevent unintentional service
deletion. This does not shield against deleting databases or topics but for services
with backups much of the content can at least be restored from backup in case accidental
deletion is done.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3AggregatorState-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3aggregator.ts#L283">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3AggregatorState-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3aggregator.ts#L298">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3AggregatorState-terminationProtection">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3DbArgs-cloudName">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3DbState-maintenanceWindowDow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3db.ts#L271">property <b>maintenanceWindowDow</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maintenanceWindowDow?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

On monday, tuesday, wednesday, etc.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3DbState-maintenanceWindowTime">

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maintenanceWindowTime?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

UTC time in HH:mm:ss format.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3DbState-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3db.ts#L287">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3DbState-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3db.ts#L293">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3DbState-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3db.ts#L302">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.
