<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="M3DbState-terminationProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/m3db.ts#L348">property <b>terminationProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>terminationProtection?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

prevents the service from being deleted. It is recommended to
set this to `true` for all production services to prevent unintentional service
deletion. This does not shield against deleting databases or topics but for services
with backups much of the content can at least be restored from backup in case accidental
deletion is done.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MySqlArgs-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/mySql.ts#L375">property <b>cloudName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cloudName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

</h4>

defines MySQL specific additional configuration options. The following
configuration options available:

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MySqlArgs-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/mySql.ts#L406">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MySqlArgs-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/mySql.ts#L412">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MySqlArgs-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/mySql.ts#L421">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

can be used to define service integrations that must exist
immediately upon service creation. By the time of writing the only such integration is
defining that MySQL service is a read-replica of another service. To define a read-
replica the following configuration needs to be added:

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MySqlArgs-serviceName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/mySql.ts#L434">property <b>serviceName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>serviceName: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

specifies the actual name of the service. The name cannot be changed
later without destroying and re-creating the service so name should be picked based on
intended service usage rather than current attributes.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MySqlArgs-terminationProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/mySql.ts#L442">property <b>terminationProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>terminationProtection?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

prevents the service from being deleted. It is recommended to
set this to `true` for all production services to prevent unintentional service
deletion. This does not shield against deleting databases or topics but for services
with backups much of the content can at least be restored from backup in case accidental
deletion is done.

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted

like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

defines PostgreSQL specific additional configuration options. The following
configuration options available:

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PgArgs-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/pg.ts#L402">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PgArgs-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/pg.ts#L417">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PgState-terminationProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/pg.ts#L356">property <b>terminationProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>terminationProtection?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

prevents the service from being deleted. It is recommended to
set this to `true` for all production services to prevent unintentional service
deletion. This does not shield against deleting databases or topics but for services
with backups much of the content can at least be restored from backup in case accidental
deletion is done.

UUID is not shown in the UI it is typically easier to use the last 4 digits to identify

some other project attributes like technical contacts from. This is mostly relevant when
an existing project has billing type set to invoice and that needs to be copied over to a

effect when the project is created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RedisArgs-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/redis.ts#L365">property <b>cloudName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cloudName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RedisArgs-maintenanceWindowDow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/redis.ts#L370">property <b>maintenanceWindowDow</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maintenanceWindowDow?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

day of week when maintenance operations should be performed.
On monday, tuesday, wednesday, etc.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RedisArgs-maintenanceWindowTime">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/redis.ts#L375">property <b>maintenanceWindowTime</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maintenanceWindowTime?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

time of day when maintenance operations should be performed.
UTC time in HH:mm:ss format.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RedisArgs-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/redis.ts#L386">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RedisArgs-project">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/redis.ts#L392">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RedisArgs-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/redis.ts#L401">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RedisArgs-redis">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/redis.ts#L406">property <b>redis</b></a>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RedisState-cloudName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/redis.ts#L253">property <b>cloudName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cloudName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines where the cloud provider and region where the service is hosted
in. This can be changed freely after service is created. Changing the value will trigger
a potentially lengthy migration process for the service. Format is cloud provider name
(`aws`, `azure`, `do` `google`, `upcloud`, etc.), dash, and the cloud provider
specific region name. These are documented on each Cloud provider's own support articles,
like [here for Google](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/) and
[here for AWS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Concepts.RegionsAndAvailabilityZones.html).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RedisState-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/redis.ts#L278">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

defines what kind of computing resources are allocated for the service. It can
be changed after creation, though there are some restrictions when going to a smaller
plan such as the new plan must have sufficient amount of disk space to store all current
data and switching to a plan with fewer nodes might not be supported. The basic plan
names are `hobbyist`, `startup-x`, `business-x` and `premium-x` where `x` is
(roughly) the amount of memory on each node (also other attributes like number of CPUs
and amount of disk space varies but naming is based on memory). The exact options can be
seen from the Aiven web console's Create Service dialog.

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/redis.ts#L284">property <b>project</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>project?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

identifies the project the service belongs to. To set up proper dependency
between the project and the service, refer to the project as shown in the above example.
Project cannot be changed later without destroying and re-creating the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RedisState-projectVpcId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aiven/blob/65e226ce3096832cea836e71db1b12027eba858a/sdk/nodejs/redis.ts#L293">property <b>projectVpcId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>projectVpcId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

optionally specifies the VPC the service should run in. If the value
is not set the service is not run inside a VPC. When set, the value should be given as a
reference as shown above to set up dependencies correctly and the VPC must be in the same
cloud and region as the service itself. Project can be freely moved to and from VPC after
creation but doing so triggers migration to new servers so the operation can take
significant amount of time to complete if the service has a lot of data.
